name: GetAttachments
description:
Retrieve all attachments for a specified Asana object.

This tool returns all attachments associated with a specified Asana object. It can be used to get attachments for projects, project briefs, and tasks. For projects, it provides files from the "Key resources" section; for project briefs, inline files in the brief itself; for tasks, all associated files, including inline images in descriptions.

parameters.name: object_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the Asana object to fetch attachments from, such as a `project`, `project_brief`, or `task`.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for object to fetch statuses from. Must be a GID for a `project`, `project_brief`, or `task`.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of objects to return per page, must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Token for pagination. Use this to get the next page of results. If omitted, the first page is returned. Use only tokens from previous responses.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include, which are excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Return the response in a readable format with line breaks and indentation. Recommended for debugging as it may increase response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.
